article.title: New constraints on the disk characteristics and companion candidates around T Cha with VLT/SPHERE

multiple_choice_question.text: What physical phenomenon is likely the prime contributor to the non-azimuthal polarization signal (Uφ) seen in the H-band IRDIS-DPI image of T Cha?
choices: Multiple scattering of light in the inner disk

multiple_choice_question.text: Which statement best describes the brightness distribution along the bright arc of scattered light seen in both the H-band and VBB Qφ images?
choices: The brightness is uniform along the arc.
The eastern side of the arc is significantly brighter than the western side.
The western side of the arc is significantly brighter than the eastern side.
The northern side of the arc is significantly brighter than the southern side.

multiple_choice_question.text: What type of structure is revealed in the total intensity IRDIS-ADI H2H3-band images of T Cha after processing?
choices: A point source within the gap

multiple_choice_question.text: What can be concluded by comparing the scattering properties (-Z12/Z11) of the two dust grain size distributions presented in Figure 7?
choices: The model with a narrow grain size distribution peaked around ~10µm better matches the observed polarimetric images.
The model with a wide grain size distribution (0.01 - 1000µm) better matches the observed polarimetric images.
Both models match the observed polarimetric images equally well.
Neither model can explain the observed polarimetric images.
